H0.text: What was the Roman name for England. Britannia

H1.text: What was the Roman name for England. Hibernia

H2.text: What was the Roman name for England. Caledonia

H3.text: What was the Roman name for England. Albion

A4.text: the use of Caledonia, one of the Latin terms for Scotland, and Britannia for Britain

A5.text: Hibernia ... became the main Latin name for Ireland

A6.text: the area they called Caledonia was physically separated from the rest of the island by the Antonine Wall. It remained outside the administration of Roman Britain

A7.text: Another, post-conquest, Roman name for the island of Great Britain was Albion
